SEARCH
Package com.unifiedcontainermanager.Strategy

Class ContainerService

java.lang.Object
com.unifiedcontainermanager.Strategy.ContainerService
All Implemented Interfaces:
ContainerManager, ImageManager, Closeable, AutoCloseable
public class ContainerService extends Object implements ContainerManager, ImageManager, Closeable
Facade for the Unified Container Management Library. Provides a single entry point for interacting with containerization tools. Auto-detects available tools and delegates operations to the appropriate strategy.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    ContainerService()
    Constructs a ContainerService with a default tool detection order (Podman > Docker > Buildah).
    ContainerService(List<ToolType> preferredToolOrder)
    Constructs a ContainerService with a specified preferred tool order for detection.

  • Constructor Details

    • ContainerService

      public ContainerService()
      Constructs a ContainerService with a default tool detection order (Podman > Docker > Buildah).

    • ContainerService

      public ContainerService(List<ToolType> preferredToolOrder)
      Constructs a ContainerService with a specified preferred tool order for detection.
      Parameters:
      preferredToolOrder - The order in which to prefer tools.

  • Method Details

    • initialize

      public void initialize() throws ToolNotFoundException
      Initializes the ContainerService by detecting and selecting an active container tool strategy. This method must be called before any other operations. This is a blocking call for initialization simplicity in the constructor or an explicit init method. For fully async init, return CompletableFuture.
      Throws:
      ToolNotFoundException - if no suitable container tool can be detected and initialized.

    • initializeAsync

      public CompletableFuture<Object> initializeAsync()
      Asynchronously initializes the ContainerService.
      Returns:
      A CompletableFuture that completes when initialization is done, or exceptionally if it fails.

      Parameters:

      timeoutSeconds - Optional timeout in seconds to wait before killing the container. Null for default.

      A CompletableFuture that completes when the stop command is issued.

    • removeContainer

      public CompletableFuture<Void> removeContainer(String containerId, boolean force, boolean removeVolumes)
      Description copied from interface: ContainerManager
      Removes a container. The container should typically be stopped first.
      Specified by:
      removeContainer in interface ContainerManager
      Parameters:
      containerId - The ID of the container to remove.
      force - If true, forcefully remove the container (e.g., if it's running).
      removeVolumes - If true, remove anonymous volumes associated with the container.
      Returns:
      A CompletableFuture that completes when the remove command is issued.

    • listContainers

      public CompletableFuture<List<ContainerInfo>> listContainers(boolean listAll)
      Description copied from interface: ContainerManager
      Lists containers.
      Specified by:
      listContainers in interface ContainerManager
      Parameters:
      listAll - If true, lists all containers (including stopped ones). Otherwise, lists only running containers.
      Returns:
      A CompletableFuture holding a list of ContainerInfo objects.

    • getContainerLogs

      public CompletableFuture<Void> getContainerLogs(String containerId, LogOptions options, Consumer<String> logConsumer)
      Description copied from interface: ContainerManager
      Retrieves logs from a container.
      Specified by:
      getContainerLogs in interface ContainerManager
      Parameters:
      containerId - The ID of the container.
      options - Options for fetching logs (e.g., follow, tail).
      logConsumer - A consumer that will receive log lines as they are emitted. For non-following logs, this might be called multiple times until all logs are delivered. For following logs, this will be called continuously.
      Returns:
      A CompletableFuture that completes when the log streaming setup is done (for follow) or all logs are fetched.

    • inspectContainer

      public CompletableFuture<ContainerInfo> inspectContainer(String containerIdOrName)

      Parameters:

      Returns:

    • pullImage

      public CompletableFuture<Void> pullImage(String imageName, String tag, Consumer<String> progressConsumer)
      Description copied from interface: ImageManager
      Pulls an image from a registry.
      Specified by:
      pullImage in interface ImageManager
      Parameters:
      imageName - The name of the image to pull (e.g., "ubuntu" or "[registry.hub.docker.com/library/ubuntu](https://registry.hub.docker.com/library/ubuntu)").
      tag - The tag of the image (e.g., "latest", "20.04"). If null, often defaults to "latest".
      progressConsumer - Optional consumer for progress updates during the pull.
      Returns:
      A CompletableFuture that completes when the image pull is finished.

    • removeImage

      public CompletableFuture<Void> removeImage(String imageIdOrName, boolean force, boolean pruneChildren)
      Description copied from interface: ImageManager
      Removes an image from local storage.
      Specified by:
      removeImage in interface ImageManager
      Parameters:
      imageIdOrName - The ID or name/tag of the image to remove.
      force - If true, forcefully remove the image (e.g., even if containers are using it).
      pruneChildren - If true, remove dangling parent images.
      Returns:
      A CompletableFuture that completes when the remove command is issued.

    • close

      public void close() throws IOException
      Closes any resources held by the active strategy (e.g., HTTP clients). It's good practice to call this when the ContainerService is no longer needed.
      Specified by:
      close in interface AutoCloseable
      Specified by:
      close in interface Closeable
      Throws:
      IOException - if closing resources fails.
